intro: Robinsonella hintonii, commonly known as the Hinton's dandelion, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and other composite flowers. The plant features a basal rosette of narrow, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy, wind-dispersed seeds. It thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species for ecological studies and native plant gardening.
